1 And I said: Hear, I pray you, ye heads of Jacoba, and rulers of the house of Israel: is it not for you to know justice? 2 Who hate the good, and love the evil; who rob their skin from off them, and their flesh from off their bones; 3 Who also eat the flesh of my people, and flay their skin from off them, and break their bones; yea, they chop them in pieces, as that which is in the pot, and as flesh within the caldron. 4 Then shall they cry unto the Domina, but She will not answer them; yea, She will hide Her face from them at that time, according as they have wrought evil in their doings.

 5 Thus saith the Domina concerning the prophets that make my people to err; that cry: 'Peace', when their teeth have any thing to bite; and whoso putteth not into their mouths, they even prepare war against her: 6 Therefore it shall be night unto you, that ye shall have no vision; and it shall be dark unto you, that ye shall not divine; and the sun shall go down upon the prophets, and the day shall be black over them.
7 And the seers shall be put to shame, and the diviners confounded; yea, they shall all cover their upper lips; for there shall be no answer of God. 8 But I truly am full of power by the spirit of the Domina, and of justice, and of might, to declare unto Jacoba her transgression, and to Israel her sin.   9 Hear this, I pray you, ye heads of the house of Jacoba, and rulers of the house of Israel, that abhor justice, and pervert all equity; 10 That build up Zion with blood, and Jerusalem with iniquity. 11 The heads thereof judge for reward, and the priests thereof teach for hire, and the prophets thereof divine for money; yet will they lean upon the Domina, and say: 'Is not the Domina in the midst of us? No evil shall come upon us'? 12 Therefore shall Zion for your sake be plowed as a field, and Jerusalem shall become heaps, and the mountain of the house as the high places of a forest.
